message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of inferring the underlying network structure and infection times in a contagion process, which is a topic that falls under the sub-fields of social network analysis, machine learning, and data mining. The use of Bayesian inference and Monte Carlo Markov Chain techniques suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). The focus on time series analysis and sequential Monte Carlo methods also suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-category of cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing). The use of statistical modeling and prior distributions suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). The application of the proposed algorithms to real-world datasets suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-category of cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the use of information theory and signal processing techniques suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-category of cs.IT (Information Theory).
